name: places/ChIJZwFOi-hYwokRVWHRoiOPUJw
formattedAddress: 245 E 63rd St #110, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 245 E 63rd St #110, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: Dr. St Laurent was amazing! She was so friendly and made sure I was comfortable my entire visit. She took the time to explain what she was doing every step of the way, show me my problem areas, and answer any questions about next steps and insurance. She was very thorough, provided great advice, and made sure I was all set with my follow up appointments before I left. She made going to the dentist easy and enjoyable. I highly recommend her!!

text.text: Dr. St Laurent was amazing! She was so friendly and made sure I was comfortable my entire visit. originalText.text: Good old fashion dentist off. Every one is nice and the work they do is decent.  No TV or luxury "suites" like newer dentist but again, it's like a dentist you used to go to when you were a kid.

text.text: Good old fashion dentist off. Every one is nice and the work they do is decent.  No TV or luxury "suites" like newer dentist but again, it's like a dentist you used to go to when you were a kid.

originalText.text: Dr Brick and his staff are the best! I will never go anywhere else. He takes the time to explain everything to you step by step. He answers all your questions and concerns. He staff are all professional. His office is clean and comfy and welcoming. I love it there.

text.text: Dr Brick and his staff are the best! I will never go anywhere else. He takes the time to explain everything to you step by step. He answers all your questions and concerns. He staff are all professional. His office is clean and comfy and welcoming. I love it there.

originalText.text:
I am finally getting around to leave this review. My experience here was good for regular check ups and cleaning, but really bad for whitening. Even though my appointment was to see a dentist before the procedure, that did not happen. A nurse did the whole process alone. I told her I have sensitive teeth, but she didn't recommend the at-home treatment which looking back would have been better for me. Next day my lips started to get red and swollen. The dentist whom I was supposed to see agreed to see me. He said it could have been allergic reaction from vitamin E, or something that I did, for example, touching something on the subway and touching my lips. Neither is the case. On the second day, my lips got worse. It lookee like I had hundreds little herpes on my lip lines. It hurt so much. It hurt to smile, drink water not to mention to eat. They would rip and ooze yellow puss. I went to see the dentist again next day. His only explanation was "I've never seen this reaction before". They did not bring the nurse who treated me to speak to me. No matter what exactly caused it, I was certain it was the whitening. And the dentist showed no empathy. He even accused me of making things worse by touching my lips. There was no apology. There was no admission of any wrongdoing. There was no refund to make things right.

To conclude, I would not recommend New York Dental Office for teeth whitening. After all that, my teeth came back to their original color at the end of that week. I was careful about eating only white food. It took over a week to recover. The business representative of the office contacted me to try to make things right, but no refund was offered and they eventually stopped contacting me. The doctor's name is Corey Brick.

originalText.text:
Dr. Brick is very thorough and precise. In addition he has a gentle touch and an empathetic nature. What more could you want in a dentist?

Once again Dr. Brick showed me what a smart and capable dentist he is. I trust him completely.

Frada did my cleaning . She has a very gentle touch and I think I get the best and most thorough cleaning from her.
